SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.twitterapime.xauth.ui
Class OAuthDialogWrapper

java.lang.Object
  com.twitterapime.xauth.ui.OAuthDialogWrapper

public abstract class OAuthDialogWrapper
extends java.lang.Object

This class defines a wrapper for a browser component, which will hold the authentication process to Twitter. It is responsible for informing to Twitter all the parameters about the application that is trying to get access to a given user account.

In addition, this class also tracks the process in order to identify when the authorization is granted or denied, so it can notify the application. This notification is done through a listener object that implements OAuthDialogListener.

Before using this class, the developer must register an app on Twitter Developer website.

Since:
1.8
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ernandes Mourao Junior (ernandes@gmail.com)

Load the Twitter's login page, so the user can enter his credentials.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If consumer key, secret or Url is null.

login

public void login(java.lang.String pinCode)

Process the authentication using the PIN-code informed by the Twitter's authentication page.

Use this method only if you are using "Out-of-band" mode.

Parameters:
pinCode - PIN-code.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If PIN-code is empty/null.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If login() was not previously called.
